Dendrobium longicornu Lindl.
, Edwards’s Bot. Reg. 16: t. 1315, 1830

)
.
Distribution:— The Himalayas, northeastern India , Myanmar , Vietnam and southwestern and southern China .

Dendrobium luteolum
Bateman, Gard. Chron . 1864: 269
, 1864. Type :— MYANMAR . Mon State : Mawlamyine District ,
Parish 139
( holotype : K)

Homotypic synonym:
Callista luteola (Bateman) Kuntze, Revis.
Gen . Pl.
2: 655, 1891.

Heterotypic synonyms:
Dendrobium luteolum Bateman var. chlorocentrum Rchb.
f., Gard. Chron ., n.s., 19: 340, 1883.
Dendrobium luteolum Bateman subvar. chlorocentrum
(Rchb.f.) H.J.Veitch, Man. Orch. Pl. 3: 57, 1888. Type:— MYANMAR . Without locality: cult. Williams s.n. ( holotype : W-R).

Dendrobium luteolum
Bateman var. superbum Rolfe, Orchid Rev.
3: 73, 1895. Type :— MYANMAR . Without locality: cult.
Sander & Co. s.n.
(not located).

Specimens examined:—
MON . Mawlamyine District : type ; same loc., cult.
Low s.n.
( K ). WITHOUT LOCALITY. Types ; without collector s.n. ( AMES ). Reported from
Chin State and Tanintharyi Region by
Kress et al. (2003: 74)
, but we have not seen material from these areas.
Note:— An attractive species that has recently reappeared in cultivation.
